title: Implement Immix mark-and-sweep collection
body:
Implement the mark-and-sweep collection phase for the Immix GC.

**Deliverables:**
- Root scanning: identify GC roots (stack pointers, global variables)
- Mark phase: trace from roots, mark live objects and their containing lines
- Sweep phase: reclaim blocks/lines that contain no live objects
- Line-granularity reclamation: free individual lines within blocks
- Update the free-list / bump pointer for reuse of reclaimed space
- GC triggering heuristic (e.g. collect when N blocks are full)
- Unit tests: allocate, discard references, collect, verify memory is reclaimed
- Stress test: allocate/free cycle to verify no leaks

**Design notes:**
- Root scanning is the hardest part — need to know which stack values are pointers
- Options: conservative scanning (treat everything as potential pointer) or precise scanning (maintain a root set)
- Start with conservative scanning for simplicity
- Do NOT implement opportunistic defragmentation yet (14-04)
